page.title: 08The Range.
page.content: {The Range}is part of The Salisbury Plain.The land has been owned by The Army for 80 years.The farmers pay a low rent for the land because of military activity in the area. The Range has a lot of wildlife.We recorded some of the birds there were Skylark,Cuckoo,Crow and Pigeon.Cattle, Sheep,Hares,Mice,Moles,Badgers and Deers can also be found. Most of the{trees}in the area were not indigenous.One wood called Dumbell Copse contained Beech trees and Fir trees. Near the woods is a place known as The Dog Graves.There are seven graves thought to be those of farm dogs. When the Red Army Flags are flying the general public can not use certain parts of The Range.
